intro: Ranunculus probiflorus, commonly known as the showy buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features showy, yellow flowers with five to nine petals, often surrounded by a ring of white or pale yellow sepals. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and trifoliate leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and wildflower displays.
